item.title: Recognizing the 29th anniversary of the Tribal Canoe Journey of the Tribal Nations of the Pacific Northwest and congratulating the Puyallup Tribe of Indians for hosting the 2018 Power Paddle to Puyallup.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Indian, Insular and Alaska Native Affairs.

item.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.
Passed/agreed to in Senate: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.
Senate Committee on Indian Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S7528)
Senate Committee on Indian Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S7528)
Committee on Indian Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Referred to the Committee on Indian Affairs. (text of measure as introduced: CR S5428)

summary.text:
Recognizes the 29th anniversary of the Tribal Canoe Journey.

Acknowledges that the Tribal Canoe Journey is a vital part of the fabric and culture of the Tribal Nations of the Pacific Northwest.

Congratulates the Puyallup Tribe of Indians for hosting the 2018 Power Paddle to Puyallup.

Recognizes the 29th anniversary of the Tribal Canoe Journey.

Congratulates the Puyallup Tribe of Indians for hosting the 2018 Power Paddle to Puyallup.

bill.title: A resolution recognizing the 29th anniversary of the Tribal Canoe Journey of the Tribal Nations of the Pacific Northwest and congratulating the Puyallup Tribe of Indians for hosting the 2018 Power Paddle to Puyallup.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
